ground_truth: He pops off his cuffs, pulls out a Tommy gun, and bashes the guard as the officer points his own shotgun through the barred door. A guard quickly opens it, and they barge in just as the escapees force their captives into the room. As the guards strip, Dillinger shakes hands with the older inmate and unlocks the steel door. The stocky escapee faces a guard, and as Dillinger opens the door, the impersonating officer steps outside. Dillinger shuts the door behind him, and outside, Red leaves the metal gate behind and crosses the open ground towards the sedan, glancing back to the lookout turret. Inside, Dillinger waits with his Tommy gun as the gang continues to dress, and one guard faces the stocky inmate who smashes the defiant law man with his pipe. A guard reaches for the younger inmate's gun, and the younger inmate shoots him, capturing the rest of the room's attention. Outside, Red walks backward 20 yards from the gate while inside, the criminals run out, leaving their hostages behind. On the lookout turret, guards take aim as Dillinger crosses through the metal gate, followed by his now partially dressed gang. As the escapees race past him, Dillinger faces the entrance and fires his Tommy gun up at the watch tower. One escapee gets shot despite a barrage of gunfire from Dillinger and his armed cohorts. Walter hurries from the gate, still limping, and his sandy haired accomplice helps him along and fires back at the tower. Inside the turret, a guard goes down. As Walter reaches the getaway car, another guard fires a rifle, and shot in the back, Walter collapses. Standing on the running board, Dillinger grabs his arm as they drive away. His body dragging across the dirt, Walter hangs onto Dillinger's arm, grimacing in pain while Dillinger struggles to keep his grip while holding onto the moving car himself. Walter looks up to his old friend and grins, then his hardened face goes blank. His grip on Dillinger's forearm gives way, and the gang leader lets him go. Walter's body slides to a stop in the dirt as the car drives off, leaving a cloud of dust behind. Dillinger lingers for a moment and climbs into the back of the moving sedan. As the sandy haired escapee shuts the door, Dillinger puts a handgun to Shouse's neck. Red drives, sitting next to the younger escapee, and Dillinger lowers his handgun and punches Shouse in the face a couple of times. He opens the car door and throws him out of the moving vehicle, and Shouse lands on the side of the road, face down in the grass. Dillinger closes the sedan's door and sits back in his seat next to the sandy-haired Pete.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: He snaps off his links, draws out a Thompson submachine gun, and strikes the warden as the constable aims his own scattergun through the barred entryway. A warden quickly opens it, and they charge in just as the fugitives compel their prisoners into the chamber. As the wardens undress, Dillinger grips hands with the elder convict and unbolts the alloy portal. The stout fugitive confronts a warden, and as Dillinger unseals the gateway, the masquerading constable steps outside. Dillinger latches the gateway behind him, and outside, Red abandons the metallic barricade behind and traverses the open terrain towards the automobile, peering back to the watchtower. Inside, Dillinger waits with his Thompson submachine gun as the crew continues to attire, and one warden confronts the stout convict who strikes the rebellious officer with his tube. A warden reaches for the junior convict's firearm, and the junior convict shoots him, seizing the remainder of the chamber's focus. Outside, Red ambles backward 20 yards from the barrier while inside, the offenders rush out, leaving their captives behind. On the watchtower, wardens aim as Dillinger crosses through the metallic barricade, followed by his now partially attired crew. As the fugitives sprint past him, Dillinger confronts the entrance and discharges his Thompson submachine gun upward at the lookout post. One fugitive gets shot despite a volley of gunfire from Dillinger and his armed allies. Walter hastens from the barrier, still hobbling, and his flaxen-haired associate assists him along and fires back at the post. Inside the lookout post, a warden falls. As Walter reaches the escape car, another warden fires a rifle, and shot in the back, Walter collapses. Standing on the running board, Dillinger grips his limb as they drive away. His form dragging across the soil, Walter clings to Dillinger's limb, grimacing in anguish while Dillinger struggles to retain his clutch while holding onto the moving car himself. Walter gazes up to his old companion and grins, then his toughened visage goes blank. His clutch on Dillinger's forearm gives way, and the crew chief lets him go. Walter's form slides to a halt in the soil as the car drives off, leaving a cloud of grit behind. Dillinger lingers for a moment and climbs into the back of the moving automobile. As the flaxen-haired fugitive closes the door, Dillinger puts a pistol to Shouse's neck. Red drives, sitting next to the junior fugitive, and Dillinger lowers his pistol and strikes Shouse in the visage a couple of times. He opens the car portal and throws him out of the moving vehicle, and Shouse lands on the side of the road, face down in the herbage. Dillinger shuts the automobile's portal and sits back in his place next to the flaxen-haired Pete.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: His cuffs are popped off by him, a Tommy gun is pulled out, and the guard is bashed by him as a shotgun is pointed through the barred door by the officer. It is quickly opened by a guard, and they barge in just as their captives are forced into the room by the escapees. As the guards strip, hands are shaken by Dillinger with the older inmate and the steel door is unlocked by him. A guard is faced by the stocky escapee, and as the door is opened by Dillinger, the door is stepped outside of by the impersonating officer. The door is shut by Dillinger behind him, and outside, the metal gate is left by Red and the open ground is crossed towards the sedan, glancing back to the lookout turret. Inside, the Tommy gun is held by Dillinger as the gang continues to dress, and a guard is faced by the stocky inmate who smashes the defiant law man with his pipe. The younger inmate's gun is reached for by a guard, and he shoots him, capturing the rest of the room's attention. Outside, 20 yards are walked backward by Red from the gate while inside, the hostages are left behind by the criminals running out. On the lookout turret, aim is taken by the guards as the metal gate is crossed through by Dillinger, followed by his now partially dressed gang. As the entrance is faced by Dillinger, his Tommy gun is fired up at the watch tower. Despite a barrage of gunfire from his armed cohorts, one escapee is shot. Walter hurries from the gate, still limping, and his sandy-haired accomplice helps him along and fires back at the tower. Inside the turret, a guard is shot down. As Walter reaches the getaway car, a rifle is fired by another guard, and Walter collapses, shot in the back. On the running board, Dillinger grabs his arm as they drive away. His body is dragged across the dirt by Walter, holding onto Dillinger's arm and grimacing in pain while Dillinger struggles to keep his grip while holding onto the moving car himself. Walter looks up to his old friend and grins, then his hardened face goes blank. Dillinger lets him go as his grip on his forearm gives way. Walter's body is slid to a stop in the dirt as the car drives off, leaving a cloud of dust behind. Dillinger lingers for a moment and climbs into the back of the moving sedan. As the door is shut by the sandy-haired escapee, a handgun is put to Shouse's neck by Dillinger. Red drives, sitting next to the younger escapee, and Dillinger lowers the handgun and punches Shouse in the face a couple of times. The car door is opened by him and he throws him out of the moving vehicle, and Shouse lands on the side of the road, face down in the grass. The sedan's door is closed by Dillinger and he sits back in his seat next to the sandy-haired Pete.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: He removes his cuffs, grabs a Tommy gun, and hits the guard as an officer aims a shotgun through the door. A guard opens it, and they enter while the escapees force captives inside. As guards strip, Dillinger shakes hands with an older inmate and unlocks the door. The stocky escapee confronts a guard as Dillinger opens the door, and the impersonating officer exits. Dillinger shuts the door, and Red leaves the gate, crossing to a sedan and glancing back at the turret. Inside, Dillinger waits with his Tommy gun as the gang dresses, and the stocky inmate hits the defiant guard with a pipe. A guard reaches for a younger inmate's gun, the inmate shoots him, capturing the room's attention. Outside, Red retreats 20 yards from the gate as the criminals escape, leaving hostages. In the turret, guards aim as Dillinger and his gang exit through the gate. Dillinger faces the entrance, firing at the tower. An escapee is shot despite their gunfire. Walter limps from the gate, aided by his sandy-haired partner who fires at the tower. A guard in the turret is hit. As Walter reaches the getaway car, another guard fires, and Walter, shot in the back, collapses. Dillinger grabs his arm as the car moves. Walter, in pain, clings to Dillinger's arm until his grip weakens, and Dillinger lets him go. Walter's body stops in the dirt as the car speeds away, leaving dust. Dillinger pauses, climbs into the sedan, and the sandy-haired escapee closes the door. Dillinger puts a handgun to Shouse's neck. Red drives with the younger escapee; Dillinger lowers his gun and hits Shouse, throwing him out of the moving car. Shouse lands face down in the grass. Dillinger closes the sedan door and sits next to the sandy-haired Pete.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: He removes his cuffs, draws a Tommy gun, and hits a guard as an officer aims a shotgun through the barred door. A guard opens it, and they enter as the escapees force captives into the room. As guards strip, Dillinger shakes hands with an older inmate and unlocks the steel door. The stocky escapee confronts a guard, and as Dillinger opens the door, the impersonating officer leaves. Dillinger shuts the door, and outside, Red crosses the open ground to the sedan, glancing back at the lookout turret. Inside, Dillinger waits with his Tommy gun while the gang dresses, and the stocky inmate smashes a defiant guard with his pipe. A guard reaches for the younger inmate’s gun, and the younger inmate shoots him, gaining control. Outside, Red retreats 20 yards from the gate while criminals escape, leaving hostages. Guards in the turret aim as Dillinger crosses the metal gate with his gang. As escapees pass, Dillinger fires at the watchtower. One is shot despite gunfire from Dillinger and his cohorts. Walter limps from the gate, assisted by a sandy-haired accomplice who fires back at the tower. Inside the turret, a guard falls. Walter reaches the car, another guard fires, and Walter collapses, shot in the back. Dillinger grabs his arm as they drive away, and Walter grimaces, dragging in the dirt. Walter looks up, grins, then goes blank as his grip fails. His body stops in the dirt as the car leaves. Dillinger climbs into the moving sedan. The sandy-haired escapee shuts the door, Dillinger threatens Shouse with a handgun, then punches him and throws him out of the car. Shouse lands face down on the grass. Dillinger closes the door and sits beside the sandy-haired Pete.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: He quickly pops off his cuffs with a sense of urgency and determination, then swiftly pulls out a Tommy gun, an instrument of violence, before bashing the guard with force as the officer on the opposite side aims his own shotgun through the barred door. Another guard swiftly takes action by opening it, allowing them to barge in aggressively at the very moment when the escapees compel their captives into the room. As the guards are stripped of their uniforms, Dillinger takes a moment to shake hands with the older inmate, demonstrating a mutual respect, and proceeds to unlock the imposing steel door. The stocky escapee stands face to face with a guard, and as Dillinger opens the door, the officer impersonator makes his way outside. Dillinger then shuts the door behind him securely, and outside, Red leaves the metal gate behind to cross the expansive open ground towards the waiting sedan, all the while habitually glancing back at the intimidating lookout turret. Inside, Dillinger stands with his Tommy gun ready, watching as the gang continues to change into their new clothes, while one guard finds himself confronted by the stocky inmate who suddenly smashes the defiant lawman with a pipe. A guard attempts to reach for the younger inmate's firearm, but the younger inmate is quicker and shoots him first, seizing the attention of everyone else in the room. Outside, Red cautiously walks backward approximately 20 yards away from the gate, while inside, the criminals make their hasty exit, leaving behind the hostages. Up in the lookout turret, guards prepare to take aim as Dillinger, with resolute purpose, crosses through the metal gate, closely followed by his now partially dressed gang. As the fleeing escapees rush past him, Dillinger turns to face the entrance and boldly fires his Tommy gun upwards at the watchtower. Despite the barrage of gunfire from Dillinger and his armed cohorts, one escapee unfortunately gets shot. Walter, still limping from an earlier injury, hurries away from the gate, aided by his sandy-haired accomplice who supports him and retaliates by firing back at the tower. A guard within the turret is taken down. As Walter finally reaches the getaway car, another guard fires a rifle, resulting in Walter being shot in the back and collapsing to the ground. Standing on the running board, Dillinger seizes his arm as they drive away at high speed. With his body dragging painfully across the dirt, Walter clings desperately to Dillinger's arm, grimacing in agony while Dillinger struggles to maintain his grip, simultaneously trying to hold onto the fast-moving vehicle himself. Walter glances up at his old friend and manages a grin, but soon his hardened face turns blank. His grip on Dillinger's forearm begins to falter, and eventually, the gang leader is forced to let him go. Walter's body comes to a halt on the dirt road as the car speeds off into the distance, leaving behind a cloud of dust as a reminder of their departure. Dillinger pauses momentarily, then climbs into the back of the moving sedan. As the sandy-haired escapee shuts the door with a firm click, Dillinger positions a handgun threateningly to Shouse's neck. Meanwhile, Red sits in the driver's seat next to the younger escapee, and Dillinger, with deliberate intent, lowers his handgun and punches Shouse in the face repeatedly. He then opens the car door and forcefully throws him out of the moving vehicle, resulting in Shouse landing face down in the grass on the side of the road. Dillinger calmly closes the sedan's door and settles back into his seat next to the sandy-haired Pete, ready for the next phase of their daring escape.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: With a sense of urgency and determination driving his actions, he rapidly removes his cuffs, immediately following this with the swift extraction of a Tommy gun, an instrument synonymous with violence. With considerable force, he strikes the guard, while, on the opposite side of the room, an officer takes aim with his shotgun through the barred door. Demonstrating quick reflexes, another guard promptly opens the door, providing an aggressive entry for those barging in, just as the escapees compel their captives into the room. As the guards are relieved of their uniforms, Dillinger takes a moment to exchange a handshake with the older inmate, a gesture that speaks volumes of their mutual respect for one another, before moving on to unlock the formidable steel door that stands in their way. Now face to face with a guard, the stocky escapee stands firm, and as Dillinger opens the door, the officer impersonator seizes the moment to step outside. Dillinger then securely closes the door behind him, while outside, Red moves beyond the metal gate, proceeding across the vast open ground towards the waiting sedan, all the while casting habitual glances back at the menacing lookout turret towering overhead. Inside, Dillinger stands alert, his Tommy gun at the ready, observing as his gang members exchange their clothes for new ones, while one guard becomes the unfortunate target of the stocky inmate who, with sudden ferocity, strikes the defiant lawman using a pipe. In a desperate bid for control, a guard attempts to seize the younger inmate's firearm, but the younger inmate proves quicker, shooting him first and instantly capturing the room's full attention. Meanwhile, outside, Red moves cautiously backward, maintaining a distance of approximately 20 yards from the gate, while inside, the criminals execute their hasty exit, leaving their hostages behind. In the lookout turret, guards ready themselves to fire as Dillinger, with resolute intent, makes his way through the metal gate, closely followed by his partially dressed gang. As the fleeing escapees rush past him, Dillinger turns back to face the entrance, raising his Tommy gun with bold resolve and firing upwards at the watchtower. Amidst the barrage of gunfire exchanged by Dillinger and his armed cohorts, one escapee tragically falls, shot down. Walter, still limping from a previous injury, moves away from the gate with haste, helped along by his sandy-haired accomplice who supports him and fires back at the tower in retaliation. Within the turret, a guard is brought down. As Walter finally reaches the getaway car, another guard takes aim with a rifle, causing Walter to be shot in the back, leading to his collapse on the ground. Perched on the running board, Dillinger grabs his arm as they speed away. Walter's body drags painfully across the dirt, clinging desperately to Dillinger's arm, his face contorted in agony, while Dillinger struggles to maintain his grip, equally trying to hold onto the rapidly moving vehicle. Walter looks up at his old friend with a grin that soon fades, leaving his hardened face emotionless. As his grip on Dillinger's forearm weakens, the gang leader reluctantly releases him. Walter's body eventually comes to rest on the dirt road as the car leaves behind a trail of dust that marks their departure. Dillinger pauses briefly before climbing back into the rear of the moving sedan. The sandy-haired escapee shuts the door with a decisive click, while Dillinger positions a handgun in a threatening manner against Shouse's neck. Meanwhile, Red occupies the driver's seat next to the younger escapee, and Dillinger, with deliberate aggression, lowers his handgun and begins to punch Shouse in the face repeatedly. He then opens the car door, forcefully ejecting Shouse from the moving vehicle, sending him tumbling face down into the grass at the roadside. With a calm demeanor, Dillinger shuts the sedan's door and settles back into his seat beside the sandy-haired Pete, readying himself for the next phase of their bold and daring escape.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: He quickly unfastens the cuffs from his wrists, retrieves a Tommy gun, and with forceful intent, strikes the guard just as an officer aims his shotgun through the barred door, offering a tense threat. Swiftly, a guard unlocks the door, enabling them to rush in precisely when the escapees are ushering their captives into the room. As the guards begin to disrobe, Dillinger extends his hand in a formal gesture to the older inmate and proceeds to unfasten the steel door's lock. The stout escapee stands resolutely before a guard, and with succinct timing, as Dillinger swings the door open, the officer in disguise steps out. Dillinger promptly closes the door behind himself and, outside, Red leaves the protective confines of the metal gate, traversing the open space towards the sedan while casting a cautious look back at the lookout turret. Inside, Dillinger holds his Tommy gun in a poised manner while the gang hurriedly changes clothes, and at that moment, a guard confronts the robust inmate who retaliates with a violent swing of his pipe, silencing the lawman's defiance. Another guard reaches for the younger inmate's firearm, but the inmate responds by shooting him, immediately seizing the attention of everyone in the room. Meanwhile, outside, Red retreats step by step, twenty yards from the gate, as inside, the criminals make a swift exit, abandoning their hostages. On the lookout turret, guards ready their weapons, tracking Dillinger as he progresses through the metal gate, his partially dressed gang following in his wake. As the escapees speed past, Dillinger spins to face the entrance and unleashes his Tommy gun, directing fire at the watchtower. Despite the onslaught of gunfire from Dillinger and his armed gang, one escapee is hit. Walter, limping, hastily departs from the gate, supported by his sandy-haired accomplice who simultaneously returns fire towards the tower. Inside the turret, a guard is struck down. As Walter nears the getaway vehicle, another guard takes aim and shoots him in the back, causing Walter to collapse. Positioned on the running board, Dillinger grabs Walter's arm just as the car begins to move. Walter's body is dragged along the dirt, and he clings desperately to Dillinger's arm, grimacing with the pain coursing through him, while Dillinger battles to maintain his grip amidst the motion of the car. Walter gazes upward at his old ally, a brief grin crossing his face before it fades into a blank stare. His weakening hold on Dillinger’s forearm finally loosens, prompting the gang leader to release him. Walter's body comes to a halt, lifeless in the dust, as the vehicle speeds away, leaving a swirling cloud behind. Dillinger pauses momentarily, then climbs into the back seat of the moving sedan. The sandy-haired escapee quickly closes the door, and seated next to Shouse, Dillinger presses a handgun threateningly at Shouse's neck. Red continues to drive, positioned beside the younger escapee, and Dillinger, shifting his focus, lowers the gun to deliver a series of harsh punches to Shouse’s face. He then opens the car door, roughly expelling Shouse from the moving vehicle, leaving him to land face down on the grassy roadside. Dillinger slams the sedan's door shut and settles back into his seat beside the sandy-haired Pete, the vehicle continuing its escape.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Dillinger removes his cuffs and retrieves a Tommy gun, swiftly incapacitating the guard as the officer aims a shotgun through a door. A guard opens it, and they rush in, corralling captives into the room. As the guards disrobe, Dillinger greets an older inmate and unlocks a steel door. The stocky escapee confronts a guard while the disguised officer exits. Dillinger closes the door behind him, and outside, Red advances towards the sedan, keeping an eye on the lookout tower. Inside, Dillinger holds his Tommy gun as the gang changes clothes, with the stocky inmate assaulting a guard with a pipe. A guard attempts to grab a gun from the younger inmate, who shoots him, commanding the room's attention. Red retreats from the gate, and the criminals flee, leaving hostages. In the turret, guards target Dillinger as he and his partially dressed gang pass through the gate. Dillinger fires at the watchtower while an escapee is shot. Walter limps from the gate, aided by his sandy-haired accomplice, who returns fire. In the turret, a guard is struck. Reaching the getaway car, Walter is shot in the back and collapses. Dillinger grabs Walter's arm as the car moves, attempting to hold him as Walter, in pain, clings to Dillinger. Walter grins before his face goes slack, losing grip as Dillinger lets go. Walter's body halts in the dirt while the car speeds away in a dust cloud. Dillinger briefly hesitates before climbing into the sedan's back. As the sandy-haired escapee closes the door, Dillinger threatens Shouse with a handgun, punches him, and throws him out of the moving car. Shouse lands in the grass beside the road. Dillinger shuts the door and settles beside Pete.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: He pops off his cuffs, the insignia of his past life as a lawman now meaningless, pulls out a Tommy gun, a firearm notorious during the Prohibition era for its association with gang violence, and bashes the guard as the officer points his own shotgun through the barred door. A guard quickly opens it, and they barge in just as the escapees force their captives into the room. As the guards strip, Dillinger, the infamous bank robber whose exploits captivated the nation during the Great Depression, shakes hands with the older inmate, a fellow criminal mastermind from their previous exploits, and unlocks the steel door. The stocky escapee faces a guard, and as Dillinger opens the door, the impersonating officer steps outside into the open air of the prison yard, a place designed to contain the most dangerous individuals. Dillinger shuts the door behind him, and outside, Red, known for his fiery temper and quick thinking, leaves the metal gate behind and crosses the open ground towards the sedan, a classic model favored for its speed and reliability, glancing back to the lookout turret high above them, where guards maintain a vigilant watch. Inside, Dillinger waits with his Tommy gun, his signature weapon of choice, as the gang continues to dress, and one guard faces the stocky inmate who smashes the defiant law man with his pipe, a weapon improvised from a piece of plumbing used in the prison. A guard reaches for the younger inmate's gun, and the younger inmate, a recent recruit known for his willingness to prove himself, shoots him, capturing the rest of the room's attention. Outside, Red walks backward 20 yards from the gate while inside, the criminals run out, leaving their hostages behind. On the lookout turret, guards take aim as Dillinger crosses through the metal gate, followed by his now partially dressed gang. As the escapees race past him, Dillinger faces the entrance and fires his Tommy gun up at the watch tower, aiming to suppress the guards' fire. One escapee gets shot despite a barrage of gunfire from Dillinger and his armed cohorts. Walter hurries from the gate, still limping from an old injury sustained in a previous heist, and his sandy-haired accomplice helps him along and fires back at the tower with a determined resolve. Inside the turret, a guard goes down, the echo of his fall unheeded by his fellow officers. As Walter reaches the getaway car, another guard fires a rifle, and shot in the back, Walter collapses. Standing on the running board, Dillinger, with the urgency of a leader who cannot afford to lose another man, grabs his arm as they drive away. His body dragging across the dirt, Walter hangs onto Dillinger's arm, grimacing in pain while Dillinger struggles to keep his grip while holding onto the moving car himself. Walter looks up to his old friend, a comrade from countless escapades, and grins, then his hardened face goes blank. His grip on Dillinger's forearm gives way, and the gang leader lets him go, a decision he had hoped to never make. Walter's body slides to a stop in the dirt as the car drives off, leaving a cloud of dust behind. Dillinger lingers for a moment, contemplating the cost of their freedom, and climbs into the back of the moving sedan. As the sandy-haired escapee shuts the door, Dillinger puts a handgun to Shouse's neck, the unfortunate accomplice on the wrong end of his temper. Red drives, sitting next to the younger escapee, the tension in the car palpable as Dillinger lowers his handgun and punches Shouse in the face a couple of times. He opens the car door and throws him out of the moving vehicle, and Shouse lands on the side of the road, face down in the grass. Dillinger closes the sedan's door and sits back in his seat next to the sandy-haired Pete, a trusted partner in his criminal enterprise.

In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. His body dragging across the dirt. Walter hangs onto Dillinger's arm grimacing in pain while Dillinger struggles to keep his grip while holding onto the moving car himself. Walter looks up to his old friend and grins then his hardened face goes blank. His grip on Dillinger's forearm gives way and the gang leader let us him go. Walter's body slides to a stop in the dirt as the car drives off leaving a cloud of dust behind. Dillinger lingers for a moment and climbs into the back of the moving sedan. As the sandy haired escapee shuts the door Dillinger puts a handgun to Shouse's neck. Red drives sitting next to the younger escapee and Dillinger lowers his handgun and punches Shouse in the face a couple of times. He opens the car door and throws him out of the moving vehicle and Shouse lands on the side of the road face down in the grass. Dillinger closes the sedan's door and sits back in his seat next to the sandyhaired Pete.

A guard quickly opens it and they barge in just as the escapees force their captives into the room. As the guards strip Dillinger shakes hands with the older inmate and unlocks the steel door. The stocky escapee faces a guard and as Dillinger opens the door the impersonating officer steps outside. Dillinger shuts the door behind him and outside Red leaves the metal gate behind and crosses the open ground towards the sedan glancing back to the lookout turret. Inside Dillinger waits with his Tommy gun as the gang continues to dress and one guard faces the stocky inmate who smashes the defiant law man with his pipe. A guard reaches for the younger inmate's gun and the younger inmate shoots him capturing the rest of the room's attention. Outside Red walks backward 20 yards from the gate while inside the criminals run out leaving their hostages behind. On the lookout turret guards take aim as Dillinger crosses through the metal gate followed by his now partially dressed gang. As the escapees race past him Dillinger faces the entrance and fires his Tommy gun up at the watch tower. One escapee gets shot despite a barrage of gunfire from Dillinger and his armed cohorts. Walter hurries from the gate still limping and his sandy haired accomplice helps him along and fires back at the tower. Inside the turret a guard goes down. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. As Walter reaches the getaway car another guard fires a rifle and shot in the back. Walter collapses. Standing on the running board Dillinger grabs his arm as they drive away. His body dragging across the dirt. Walter hangs onto Dillinger's arm grimacing in pain while Dillinger struggles to keep his grip while holding onto the moving car himself. Walter looks up to his old friend and grins then his hardened face goes blank. His grip on Dillinger's forearm gives way and the gang leader let us him go. Walter's body slides to a stop in the dirt as the car drives off leaving a cloud of dust behind. Dillinger lingers for a moment and climbs into the back of the moving sedan. As the sandy haired escapee shuts the door Dillinger puts a handgun to Shouse's neck. Red drives sitting next to the younger escapee and Dillinger lowers his handgun and punches Shouse in the face a couple of times. He opens the car door and throws him out of the moving vehicle and Shouse lands on the side of the road face down in the grass. Dillinger closes the sedan's door and sits back in his seat next to the sandyhaired Pete.

A guard quickly opens it and they barge in just as the escapees force their captives into the room. As the guards strip Dillinger shakes hands with the older inmate and unlocks the steel door. Dillinger shuts the door behind him and outside Red leaves the metal gate behind and crosses the open ground towards the sedan glancing back to the lookout turret. test_cases.description: He pops off his cuffs pulls out a Tommy gun and bashes the guard as the officer points his own shotgun through the barred door. A guard quickly opens it and they barge in just as the escapees force their captives into the room. As the guards strip Dillinger shakes hands with the older inmate and unlocks the steel door. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: She unhooks her scarf, unleashes a slingshot, and tickles the janitor as the baker waves his own spatula through the glass window. A janitor slowly shuts it, and they tiptoe out just as the astronauts coax their guards into the corridor. As the janitors nap, Merlin high-fives the young engineer and bolts the wooden hatch. The lanky astronaut stares at a janitor, and as Merlin bolts the hatch, the masquerading baker leaps inside. Merlin unbolts the hatch behind her, and inside, Blue enters the bamboo bridge ahead and strolls the vibrant street towards the trolley, peeking forward to the signal lamp. Inside, Merlin relaxes with her slingshot as the crew continues to nap, and one janitor greets the lanky engineer who pats the docile chef with her cap. A janitor drops for the elder engineer's knife, and the elder engineer slices her, captivating the rest of the corridor’s curiosity. Inside, Blue skips forward 30 paces from the bridge while inside, the martians jog in, keeping their companions forward. In the signal lamp, janitors lose focus as Merlin strolls through the bamboo bridge, trailed by her now halfway awake crew. As the astronauts sprint beside her, Merlin stares at the archway and hurls her slingshot down at the tree house. One astronaut gets charmed despite a cascade of pebbles from Merlin and her battle-ready bandmates. Rupert teeters beside the bridge, still prancing, and his wavy-haired collaborator nudges him forward and hurls stones at the tree house. Inside the lamp, a janitor looks up. As Rupert nears the runaway sled, another janitor swings a lasso, and hit on the leg, Rupert wobbles. Perched on the jogging board, Merlin grips his leg as they glide away. Her fingers clawing across the sand, Rupert clutches Merlin's leg, grimacing in agony while Merlin struggles to lose her grip while teetering on the sliding sled herself. Rupert gazes at his strange foe and scoffs, then his amused grin fades away. His clutching of Merlin's leg fades, and the band leader drops him. Rupert's arms roll to a pause in the sand as the sled slides off, leaving a trail of pebbles forward. Merlin dawdles for a second and topples into the front of the sliding trolley. As the wavy-haired astronaut shuts the hatch, Merlin points a musket to Ryan's foot. Blue cruises, chatting beside the elder astronaut, and Merlin raises her musket and tickles Ryan on the knee a few times. She opens the trolley hatch and flings him into the rolling wagon, and Ryan lands in the middle of the alley, back up in the mud. Merlin bolts the trolley's hatch and lays down on her seat beside the wavy-haired Sam.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Dillinger and his gang, attempting a bold escape, confront guards in a prison. Dillinger prepares with a Tommy gun, assisting escapees who overpower guards. As Dillinger opens an exit, Red heads toward their getaway sedan. A violent confrontation ensues; one guard is shot while Dillinger and the gang make their escape, firing at guards in the lookout turret. During the escape, Walter is shot and collapses. Dillinger helps him but ultimately lets him go as they drive away. After leaving Walter behind, Dillinger climbs into the car, holds a gun to Shouse, punches him, then throws him out of the moving vehicle. Dillinger finally sits back, next to his sandy-haired accomplice, Pete.
